1.name: bulbasaur
1.desc: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this POKéMON.

2.name: ivysaur
2.desc: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

3.name: venusaur
3.desc: The plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

4.name: charmander
4.desc: Obviously prefers hot places. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

5.name: charmeleon
5.desc: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the temperature to unbearably high levels.

6.name: charizard
6.desc: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to cause forest fires unintentionally.

7.name: squirtle
7.desc: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. Powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.

8.name: wartortle
8.desc: Often hides in water to stalk unwary prey. For swimming fast, it moves its ears to maintain balance.

9.name: blastoise
9.desc: A brutal POKéMON with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high speed tackles.

10.name: caterpie
10.desc: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

11.name: metapod
11.desc: This POKéMON is vulnerable to attack while its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.

12.name: butterfree
12.desc: In battle, it flaps its wings at high speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.

13.name: weedle
13.desc: Often found in forests, eating leaves. It has a sharp venomous stinger on its head.

14.name: kakuna
14.desc: Almost incapable of moving, this POKéMON can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators.

15.name: beedrill
15.desc: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.

16.name: pidgey
16.desc: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

17.name: pidgeotto
17.desc: Very protective of its sprawling territorial area, this POKéMON will fiercely peck at any intruder.

18.name: pidgeot
18.desc: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as MAGIKARP.

19.name: rattata
19.desc: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.

20.name: raticate
20.desc: It uses its whis kers to maintain its balance. It apparently slows down if they are cut off.

21.name: spearow
21.desc: It flaps its small wings busily to fly. Using its beak, it searches in grass for prey.

22.name: fearow
22.desc: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land for rest.

23.name: ekans
23.desc: Moves silently and stealthily. Eats the eggs of birds, such as PIDGEY and SPEAROW, whole.

24.name: arbok
24.desc: It is rumored that the ferocious warning markings on its belly differ from area to area.

25.name: pikachu
25.desc: When several of these POKéMON gather, their electricity could build and cause lightning storms.

26.name: raichu
26.desc: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.

27.name: sandshrew
27.desc: Burrows deep underground in arid locations far from water. It only emerges to hunt for food.

28.name: sandslash
28.desc: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.

29.name: nidoran-f
29.desc: Although small, its venomous barbs render this POKéMON dangerous. The female has smaller horns.

30.name: nidorina
30.desc: The female's horn develops slowly. Prefers physical attacks such as clawing and biting.

31.name: nidoqueen
31.desc: Its hard scales provide strong protection. It uses its hefty bulk to execute powerful moves.

32.name: nidoran-m
32.desc: Stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger its horns, the more powerful its secreted venom.

33.name: nidorino
33.desc: An aggressive POKéMON that is quick to attack. The horn on its head secretes a powerful venom.

34.name: nidoking
34.desc: It uses its powerful tail in battle to smash, constrict, then break the prey's bones.

35.name: clefairy
35.desc: Its magical and cute appeal has many admirers. It is rare and found only in certain areas.

36.name: clefable
36.desc: A timid fairy POKéMON that is rarely seen. It will run and hide the moment it senses people.

37.name: vulpix
37.desc: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.

38.name: ninetales
38.desc: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1000-year curse.

39.name: jigglypuff
39.desc: When its huge eyes light up, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.

40.name: wigglytuff
40.desc: The body is soft and rubbery. When angered, it will suck in air and inflate itself to an enormous size.

41.name: zubat
41.desc: Forms colonies in perpetually dark places. Uses ultrasonic waves to identify and approach targets.

42.name: golbat
42.desc: Once it strikes, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.

43.name: oddish
43.desc: During the day, it keeps its face buried in the ground. At night, it wanders around sowing its seeds.

44.name: gloom
44.desc: The fluid that oozes from its mouth isn't drool. It is a nectar that is used to attract prey.

45.name: vileplume
45.desc: It has the world,s largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.

46.name: paras
46.desc: Burrows to suck tree roots. The mushrooms on its back grow by draw ing nutrients from the bug host.

47.name: parasect
47.desc: A host-parasite pair in which the parasite mushroom has taken over the host bug. Prefers damp places.

48.name: venonat
48.desc: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats insects. It is attracted by light at night.

49.name: venomoth
49.desc: The dustlike scales covering its wings are color-coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has.

50.name: diglett
50.desc: Lives about one yard underground where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears above ground.

51.name: dugtrio
51.desc: A team of DIGLETT triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.

52.name: meowth
52.desc: It washes its face regularly to keep the coin on its forehead spotless. It doesn,t get along with Galarian Meowth.

53.name: persian
53.desc: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.

54.name: psyduck
54.desc: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily POKéMON will use psychokinetic powers.

55.name: golduck
55.desc: Often seen swim ming elegantly by lake shores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster, Kappa.

56.name: mankey
56.desc: Extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment then thrashing away the next instant.

57.name: primeape
57.desc: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until it is caught.

58.name: growlithe
58.desc: Very protective of its territory. It will bark and bite to repel intruders from its space.

59.name: arcanine
59.desc: A POKéMON that has been admired since the past for its beauty. It runs agilely as if on wings.

60.name: poliwag
60.desc: Its newly grown legs prevent it from running. It appears to prefer swimming than trying to stand.

61.name: poliwhirl
61.desc: Capable of living in or out of water. When out of water, it sweats to keep its body slimy.

62.name: poliwrath
62.desc: An adept swimmer at both the front crawl and breast stroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.

63.name: abra
63.desc: Using its ability to read minds, it will identify impending danger and TELEPORT to safety.

64.name: kadabra
64.desc: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches just by being close by.

65.name: alakazam
65.desc: Its brain can out perform a super computer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5,000.

66.name: machop
66.desc: Loves to build its muscles. It trains in all styles of martial arts to become even stronger.

67.name: machoke
67.desc: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

68.name: machamp
68.desc: Using its heavy muscles, it throws powerful punches that can send the victim clear over the horizon.

69.name: bellsprout
69.desc: A carnivorous POKéMON that traps and eats bugs. It uses its root feet to soak up needed moisture.

70.name: weepinbell
70.desc: It spits out POISONPOWDER to immobilize the enemy and then finishes it with a spray of ACID.

71.name: victreebel
71.desc: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.

72.name: tentacool
72.desc: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by its stinging acid.

73.name: tentacruel
73.desc: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.

74.name: geodude
74.desc: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

75.name: graveler
75.desc: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.

76.name: golem
76.desc: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without damage.

77.name: ponyta
77.desc: Its hooves are 10 times harder than diamonds. It can trample anything completely flat in little time.

78.name: rapidash
78.desc: Very competitive, this POKéMON will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.

79.name: slowpoke
79.desc: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes 5 seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.

80.name: slowbro
80.desc: The SHELLDER that is latched onto SLOWPOKE's tail is said to feed on the host's left over scraps.

81.name: magnemite
81.desc: Uses anti-gravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses THUNDER WAVE and similar moves.

82.name: magneton
82.desc: Formed by several MAGNEMITEs linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

83.name: farfetchd
83.desc: The sprig of green onions it holds is its weapon. It is used much like a metal sword.

84.name: doduo
84.desc: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.

85.name: dodrio
85.desc: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake.

86.name: seel
86.desc: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick ice.

87.name: dewgong
87.desc: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.

88.name: grimer
88.desc: Appears in filthy areas. Thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.

89.name: muk
89.desc: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

90.name: shellder
90.desc: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

91.name: cloyster
91.desc: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.

92.name: gastly
92.desc: Almost invisible, this gaseous POKéMON cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.

93.name: haunter
93.desc: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from an other dimension.

94.name: gengar
94.desc: Under a full moon, this POKéMON likes to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.

95.name: onix
95.desc: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, but colored black.

96.name: drowzee
96.desc: Puts enemies to sleep then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating bad dreams.

97.name: hypno
97.desc: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of PSI moves such as HYPNOSIS and CONFUSION.

98.name: krabby
98.desc: Its pincers are not only powerful weapons, they are used for balance when walking sideways.

99.name: kingler
99.desc: The large pincer has 10000 hp of crushing power. However, its huge size makes it unwieldy to use.

100.name: voltorb
100.desc: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a POKé BALL, they have zapped many people.

101.name: electrode
101.desc: It stores electric energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.

102.name: exeggcute
102.desc: Often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they quickly gather and attack in swarms.

103.name: exeggutor
103.desc: Legend has it that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an EXEGGCUTE.

104.name: cubone
104.desc: Because it never removes its skull helmet, no one has ever seen this POKéMON's real face.

105.name: marowak
105.desc: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to KO targets.

106.name: hitmonlee
106.desc: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra long, loping strides.

107.name: hitmonchan
107.desc: While apparently doing nothing, it fires punches in lightning fast volleys that are impossible to see.

108.name: lickitung
108.desc: Its tongue can be extended like a chameleon's. It leaves a tingling sensation when it licks enemies.

109.name: koffing
109.desc: Because it stores several kinds of toxic gases in its body, it is prone to exploding without warning.

110.name: weezing
110.desc: Where two kinds of poison gases meet, 2 KOFFINGs can fuse into a WEEZING over many years.

111.name: rhyhorn
111.desc: A POKéMON with a one-track mind. Once it charges,  it won't stop running until it falls asleep.

112.name: rhydon
112.desc: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees.

113.name: chansey
113.desc: A rare and elusive POKéMON that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to get it.

114.name: tangela
114.desc: The whole body is swathed with wide vines that are similar to sea weed. Its vines shake as it walks.

115.name: kangaskhan
115.desc: The infant rarely ventures out of its mother's protective pouch until it is 3 years old.

116.name: horsea
116.desc: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.

117.name: seadra
117.desc: Capable of swim ming backwards by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail.

118.name: goldeen
118.desc: Its tail fin billows like an elegant ballroom dress, giving it the nickname of the Water Queen.

119.name: seaking
119.desc: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.

120.name: staryu
120.desc: If its body is torn, it can grow back if the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.

121.name: starmie
121.desc: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem.

122.name: mr-mime
122.desc: If interrupted while it is miming, it will slap around the offender with its broad hands.

123.name: scyther
123.desc: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one.

124.name: jynx
124.desc: It seductively wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it.

125.name: electabuzz
125.desc: Normally found near power plants, they can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.

126.name: magmar
126.desc: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.

127.name: pinsir
127.desc: If it fails to crush the victim in its pincers, it will swing it around and toss it hard.

128.name: tauros
128.desc: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.

129.name: magikarp
129.desc: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.

130.name: gyarados
130.desc: Once it begins to rampage, a GYARADOS will burn everything down, even in a harsh storm.

131.name: lapras
131.desc: A POKéMON that has been over hunted almost to extinction. It can ferry people across the water.

132.name: ditto
132.desc: Capable of copying an enemy's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.

133.name: eevee
133.desc: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from element STONEs.

134.name: vaporeon
134.desc: Lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin which is often mistaken for a mermaid's.

135.name: jolteon
135.desc: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10000- volt lightning bolts.

136.name: flareon
136.desc: When storing thermal energy in its body, its temperature could soar to over 1600 degrees.

137.name: porygon
137.desc: A POKéMON that consists entirely of programming code. Capable of moving freely in cyberspace.

138.name: omanyte
138.desc: Although long extinct, in rare cases, it can be genetically resurrected from fossils.

139.name: omastar
139.desc: A prehistoric POKéMON that died out when its heavy shell made it impossible to catch prey.

140.name: kabuto
140.desc: A POKéMON that was resurrected from a fossil found in what was once the ocean floor eons ago.

141.name: kabutops
141.desc: Its sleek shape is perfect for swim ming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains the body fluids.

142.name: aerodactyl
142.desc: A Pokémon that roamed the skies in the dinosaur era. Its teeth are like saw blades.

143.name: snorlax
143.desc: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.

144.name: articuno
144.desc: A legendary bird POKéMON that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

145.name: zapdos
145.desc: A legendary bird POKéMON that is said to appear from clouds while dropping enormous lightning bolts.

146.name: moltres
146.desc: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.

147.name: dratini
147.desc: Long considered a mythical POKéMON until recently when a small colony was found living underwater.

148.name: dragonair
148.desc: A mystical POKéMON that exudes a gentle aura. Has the ability to change climate conditions.

149.name: dragonite
149.desc: An extremely rarely seen marine POKéMON. Its intelligence is said to match that of humans.

150.name: mewtwo
150.desc: It was created by a scientist after years of horrific gene splicing and DNA engineering experiments.

151.name: mew
151.desc: So rare that it is still said to be a mirage by many experts. Only a few people have seen it worldwide.
